content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: Score A has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures or time signatures. Score A  has only one measure consisting of a two whole notes played in succession. The pitches in score A are: B3 and E3.

Score B has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures or time signatures. Score B  has only one measure consisting of a two whole notes played in succession. The pitches in score B are: B3 and D sharp 3.

Score C has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures or time signatures. Score C  has only one measure consisting of a two whole notes played in succession. The pitches in score C are: B3 and D3.

Score D has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures or time signatures. Score D  has only one measure consisting of a two whole notes played in succession. The pitches in score D are: B3 and C sharp 3.

content.answer: Score D has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures or time signatures. Score D  has only one measure consisting of a two whole notes played in succession. The pitches in score D are: B3 and C sharp 3.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
